item.title: Sarah add a quote by H.D. Thoreau
item.description: "I love Nature partly because she is not man, but a retreat from him. None of his institutions control or pervade her. There a different kind of right prevails. In her midst I can be glad with an entire gladness. If this world were all man, I could not stretch myself, I should lose all hope. He is constraint, she is freedom to me. He makes me wish for another world. She makes me content with this." -- H.D. Thoreau

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Abbie Hoffman
item.description: "I believe in compulsory cannibalism. If people were forced to eat what they killed, there would be no more wars." -- Abbie Hoffman

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I object to violence because when it appears to do good, the good is only temporary; the evil it does is permanent." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "How wrong is it for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself?" -- Anais Nin

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "For those who believe in God, most of the big questions are answered. But for those of us who can't readily accept the God formula, the big answers don't remain stone-written. We adjust to new conditions and discoveries. We are pliable. Love need not be a command nor faith a dictum. I am my own god. We are here to unlearn the teachings of the church, state, and our educational system. We are here to drink beer. We are here to kill war. We are here to laugh at the odds and live our lives so well that Death will tremble to take us." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it." -- Rumi
